cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles SE of Galveston Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the Texas-Louisiana border, then turning north over Louisiana/Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (around Cameron–Lake Charles LA area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass TX eastward to the Alabama-Florida border, including Metropolitan New Orleans and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central Texas coast to western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-50 mph) possible with a 32% chance within the next 48 h
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along upper Texas coast with isolated spots to 4 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 6 inches across eastern Texas including Galveston, causing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents
